alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Talbot; Taylor; Upson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 6:30AM EDT until April 08 at 10:34PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oconee and Clarke Counties. Oconee River near Dublin affecting Wilkinson, Laurens, Washington and Johnson Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Alabama... Flint River near Carsonville Hwy. 19 affecting Talbot, Upson, Taylor and Crawford Counties. Oconee River near Milledgeville affecting Washington, Wilkinson and Baldwin Counties. Chattahoochee River at Columbus affecting Muscogee, Chattahoochee, Lee and Russell Counties. Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Jones, Houston, Bibb, Monroe and Twiggs Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast to continue. * WHERE...Flint River near Carsonville Hwy. 19. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 22 feet, Minor flooding expands into the woodlands and fields along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 19. The flood waters will be up to 4 feet deep over the top of the boat ramp and cover a portion of the access road by the bridge on the Taylor County side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EDT Friday the stage was 21.9 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM EDT Friday was 25.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 7.3 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 18 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
